tossups.question: Intravenous delivery of drugs like zoledronate and denosumab can cause this structure to not heal properly after surgery. This structure is the synapomorphy (“syn-AP-o-morph-y”) of the extant gnathostomes (“NATH-o-stomes”), which also possess an adaptive immune system based on V(D)J recombination. Prodigious amounts of slime are produced by animals with two extra pharyngeal arches homologous to this structure. Osteoporietic patients taking bisphosphonates occasionally develop osteonecrosis in this structure. Matchmakers used to have this structure become (*) “phossy” and fall off. The only living vertebrates to lack these structures are the hagfish and the lampreys. In humans, the TMJ connects to, for 10 points, what structure, a bone moved by the masseter muscle and containing the lower half of the teeth?
tossups.answer: jaws [or mandible; accept osteonecrosis of the jaw, jawless fish, jawed fish, lower jaw, or jawbone; prompt on ONJ, chin, skull, or temporomandibular joint]

The betrayal theory of this condition was proposed by Jennifer Freyd, and discussed by Richard McNally in a book about Remembering this subject. The scholar Bessel van der Kolk wrote a best selling book about this subject. Several Dutch studies have suggested that the game Tetris is an effective way to reduce intrusive thoughts resulting from this condition. tossups.question: This artist repeatedly said “le Coq c’est moi” (“luh coke say mwah”) in reference to his work called The Cock. The Maharaja Yashwant Rao Holkar II (“the second”) commissioned this artist to design a Temple of Meditation, which would have included sculptures such as King of Kings. Enormous eyes dominate the face of his bust of Mademoiselle Pogany. This sculptor’s bronze bust of Marie Bonaparte drew controversy for its extreme resemblance to a (*) penis. A rectangular archway, twelve stools surrounding a cylindrical table, and 15 rhomboid beads arranged into a 98-foot tower comprise this artist’s Sculptural Ensemble at Târgu Jiu (“TIRR-goo JEE-oo”). Despite its title, his most famous series of sculptures lacks wings or other distinguishing features, only depicting the motion of the title animal. For 10 points, name this Romanian-French sculptor of the Bird in Space series.

Despite its title, his most famous series of sculptures lacks wings or other distinguishing features, only depicting the motion of the title animal. For 10 points, name this Romanian-French sculptor of the Bird in Space series.

tossups.question: The migratory singlet of this molecule’s H-NMR spectrum can be eliminated by adding heavy water to leave just a triplet and a quadruplet. This molecule is retained by zeolitic (“zeo-LIT-ic”) pervaporation membranes which function as molecular sieves. Acamprosate (“a-CAM-pro-sate”) has largely replaced the use of disulfiram (“di-SUL-fur-am”) to trigger intolerance to this molecule, which should never be consumed alongside paracetamol. This molecule is a last-resort treatment for antifreeze poisoning because it competitively inhibits (*) ADH. This molecule forms an azeotrope (“AY-zeo-trope”) at roughly 24 parts per one part water, meaning it cannot be distilled beyond about 168 degrees proof. For 10 points, name this molecule with two carbons and a hydroxyl which is colloquially called “alcohol”.
tossups.answer: ethanol [or ethyl alcohol; prompt on alcohol, alcohol dehydrogenase, equivalents like booze, or specific alcohols like vodka before “alcohol”]

tossups.question: The Latvian scholar Modris Eksteins wrote an aesthetic history of this conflict, which links it to a major musical composition of the same era. This conflict provided the mnemonic framework of a 1975 book by Paul Fussell. The origins of this war were examined in The Sleepwalkers, a book by Christopher Clark. Jews were blamed for defeat in this war in the (*) “stab-in-the-back myth”. Barbara Tuchman wrote about the first days of this war in the book The Guns of August. The stodginess of fighting in this war inspired the novel All quiet on the Western Front by Remarque. In the popular imagination, Gavrilo Princip is blamed for the onset of this war. For 10 points, name this war that was settled by the Treaty of Versailles.
tossups.question_sanitized: The Latvian scholar Modris Eksteins wrote an aesthetic history of this conflict, which links it to a major musical composition of the same era. This conflict provided the mnemonic framework of a 1975 book by Paul Fussell. The origins of this war were examined in The Sleepwalkers, a book by Christopher Clark. Jews were blamed for defeat in this war in the (*) “stab-in-the-back myth”. Barbara Tuchman wrote about the first days of this war in the book The Guns of August. The stodginess of fighting in this war inspired the novel All quiet on the Western Front by Remarque. In the popular imagination, Gavrilo Princip is blamed for the onset of this war. For 10 points, name this war that was settled by the Treaty of Versailles.

tossups.question: In 2021, Ramón Díaz took over as manager of the largest football club in this city. In 2001, this city’s Aviation Club Tennis Centre began hosting an ATP 500 level tournament. In November 2021, Ian Nepomniachtchi [YAN NE-pom-nee-ah-chee] will contest a world title in this city. The final of the 2021 ICC Men’s T20 World Cup will take place in this city, which also hosted the final of the 2021 (*) Indian Premier League. The 2021 World Chess Championship will take place in this city. The football club Al Nasr is based in this city, which is home to the artificial Palm Jumeirah archipelago. Athletes visiting this city may be lucky enough to stay in the tallest building in the world, the Burj Khalifa. For 10 points, name this most populous city in the United Arab Emirates.

The final of the 2021 ICC Men’s T20 World Cup will take place in this city, which also hosted the final of the 2021 (*) Indian Premier League. The 2021 World Chess Championship will take place in this city. The football club Al Nasr is based in this city, which is home to the artificial Palm Jumeirah archipelago. Athletes visiting this city may be lucky enough to stay in the tallest building in the world, the Burj Khalifa. For 10 points, name this most populous city in the United Arab Emirates.

parts: Name this condition which affects roughly two million people worldwide. Almost half of people with mutations in the BRCA (“brack-a”) genes have this disease.

Triple-negative cancers lack receptors for HER, estrogen, and this other hormone. Estrogen builds up the endometrium while this hormone breaks it down, and they are found together in oral contraceptives.

Aromatase inhibitors are typically only prescribed for breast cancer patients with this characteristic. Patients with this characteristic have higher incidence of breast cancer because of their replacement therapy and can take low doses of SSRI antidepressants to treat vasomotor symptoms.
parts_sanitized: Name this condition which affects roughly two million people worldwide. Almost half of people with mutations in the BRCA (“brack-a”) genes have this disease.

Triple-negative cancers lack receptors for HER, estrogen, and this other hormone. Estrogen builds up the endometrium while this hormone breaks it down, and they are found together in oral contraceptives.

Aromatase inhibitors are typically only prescribed for breast cancer patients with this characteristic. Patients with this characteristic have higher incidence of breast cancer because of their replacement therapy and can take low doses of SSRI antidepressants to treat vasomotor symptoms.

parts: Name this field analogous to the E field in electrostatics. Plotting the magnitude of this field against that of a similar field measured in teslas yields a hysteresis (“hiss-ter-REE-sis”) curve.
Hysteresis is observable in materials with this property, which disappears above the Curie temperature. This attractive property is named for its presence in iron.

When hysteresis creates unwanted residual magnetization in a material, it can be removed via this process. This process was first used to keep British ships safe from magnetically-activated mines in World War II.
parts_sanitized: Name this field analogous to the E field in electrostatics. Plotting the magnitude of this field against that of a similar field measured in teslas yields a hysteresis (“hiss-ter-REE-sis”) curve.
Hysteresis is observable in materials with this property, which disappears above the Curie temperature. This attractive property is named for its presence in iron.

When hysteresis creates unwanted residual magnetization in a material, it can be removed via this process. This process was first used to keep British ships safe from magnetically-activated mines in World War II.
